tool_description: Search for train trips in Belgium using the iRail API. You can search for train departures in a certain station and search for all the stations in Belgium.
name: iRail
title: iRail

api_list.name: Departures

required_parameters.name: stationname
required_parameters.description: You can find the appropriate names in the Stations list

required_parameters.name: year
required_parameters.description: The year you want to query

required_parameters.name: hour
required_parameters.description: The number of hours in 24h style

required_parameters.name: minutes
required_parameters.description: The minutes you want to retrieve responses from

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://irail.p.rapidapi.com/NMBS/Departures/Gent Sint-Pieters/2013/11/02/13/02.json"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "irail.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://irail.p.rapidapi.com/NMBS/Departures/{stationname}/{year}/{month}/{day}/{hour}/{minutes}.json"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "irail.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Stations list
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://irail.p.rapidapi.com/NMBS/Stations.json"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "irail.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
